programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Ten years after the events of the first film, Rick (Brendan Fraser) and Evelyn (Rachel Weisz) O'Connell are settled in 1935 London, where they are raising their son. When a chain of events finds the corpse of Imhotep (Arnold Vosloo) resurrected, the O'Connells go on a desperate race to save the world from unspeakable evil and to rescue their son before it is too late.

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Cursed by a devious sorceress, China's ruthless Dragon Emperor (Jet Li) and his vast army lie buried in clay for millennia. When young archaeologist Alex O'Connell is tricked into reviving the emperor, he and his famous parents (Brendan Fraser, Maria Bello) must find a way to send the ghoul back to the grave before he can awaken his vast army and take over the world.

programme.title: Bob's Burgers

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: The Mummy is a rousing, suspenseful and horrifying epic about an expedition of treasure-seeking explorers in the Sahara Desert in 1925. Stumbling upon an ancient tomb, the hunters unwittingly set loose a 3,000-year-old legacy of terror, which is embodied in the vengeful reincarnation of an Egyptian priest who had been sentenced to an eternity as one of the living dead.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Ten years after the events of the first film, Rick (Brendan Fraser) and Evelyn (Rachel Weisz) O'Connell are settled in 1935 London, where they are raising their son. programme.title: Hercules: The Thracian Wars
programme.desc: Though he is famous across the ancient world for his larger-than-life exploits, Hercules (Dwayne Johnson), the son of Zeus and a human woman, is haunted by his tragic past. Now, he fights only for gold as a traveling mercenary, accompanied by a band of loyal followers, including Amphiarus (Ian McShane) and Autolycus. However, when the benevolent ruler of Thrace and his daughter seek his help in defeating a savage warlord, Hercules must find the true hero within himself once again.

programme.title: Shazam!
programme.desc: We all have a superhero inside of us -- it just takes a bit of magic to bring it out. In 14-year-old Billy Batson's case, all he needs to do is shout out one word to transform into the adult superhero Shazam. Still a kid at heart, Shazam revels in the new version of himself by doing what any other teen would do -- have fun while testing out his newfound powers. But he'll need to master them quickly before the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana can get his hands on Shazam's magical abilities.

programme.title: Hulk
programme.desc: Eric Bana ("Black Hawk Down") stars as scientist Bruce Banner, whose inner demons transform him in the aftermath of a catastrophic experiment; Jennifer Connelly portrays Betty Ross, whose scientific genius unwittingly helps unleash the Hulk; Nick Nolte plays Banner's brilliant father, who passes on a tragic legacy to his son; and Sam Elliott portrays the commander of a top-secret military research center.

programme.title: Doctor Strange
programme.desc: Dr. Stephen Strange's (Benedict Cumberbatch) life changes after a car accident robs him of the use of his hands. When traditional medicine fails him, he looks for healing, and hope, in a mysterious enclave. He quickly learns that the enclave is at the front line of a battle against unseen dark forces bent on destroying reality. Before long, Strange is forced to choose between his life of fortune and status or leave it all behind to defend the world as the most powerful sorcerer in existence.

programme.title: Ant-Man
programme.desc: Forced out of his own company by former protégé Darren Cross, Dr. Hank Pym (Michael Douglas) recruits the talents of Scott Lang (Paul Rudd), a master thief just released from prison. Lang becomes Ant-Man, trained by Pym and armed with a suit that allows him to shrink in size, possess superhuman strength and control an army of ants. The miniature hero must use his new skills to prevent Cross, also known as Yellowjacket, from perfecting the same technology and using it as a weapon for evil.

programme.title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance
programme.desc: Now hiding out in Eastern Europe, Johnny Blaze (Nicolas Cage) is still struggling with the curse of the Ghost Rider -- the devil's bounty hunter. Johnny meets a priest named Moreau (Idris Elba), who asks Johnny to find a boy named Danny (Fergus Riordan) and bring him back. But there's a catch -- Satan (Ciarán Hinds) is looking for the boy too, and has a personal stake in the matter. But if Johnny can find Danny first and save the boy's soul, there's a chance Johnny can save his own soul as well.

programme.title: Ghost Adventures

programme.title: Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn)
programme.desc: It's open season on Harley Quinn when her explosive breakup with the Joker puts a big fat target on her back. Unprotected and on the run, Quinn faces the wrath of narcissistic crime boss Black Mask, his right-hand man, Victor Zsasz, and every other thug in the city. But things soon even out for Harley when she becomes unexpected allies with three deadly women -- Huntress, Black Canary and Renee Montoya.

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: Convinced that mutants pose a threat to humanity, Dr. Bolivar Trask (Peter Dinklage) develops the Sentinels, enormous robotic weapons that can detect a mutant gene and zero in on that person. In the 21st century, the Sentinels have evolved into highly efficient killing machines. With mutants now facing extinction, Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) volunteers to go back in time and rally the X-Men of the past to help change a pivotal moment in history and thereby save their future.

programme.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
programme.desc: When Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.) jump-starts a dormant peacekeeping program, things go terribly awry, forcing him, Thor (Chris Hemsworth), the Incredible Hulk (Mark Ruffalo) and the rest of the Avengers to reassemble. As the fate of Earth hangs in the balance, the team is put to the ultimate test as they battle Ultron, a technological terror hell-bent on human extinction. Along the way, they encounter two mysterious and powerful newcomers, Pietro and Wanda Maximoff.

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War
programme.desc: Political pressure mounts to install a system of accountability when the actions of the Avengers lead to collateral damage. The new status quo deeply divides members of the team. Captain America (Chris Evans) believes superheroes should remain free to defend humanity without government interference. Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr.) sharply disagrees and supports oversight. As the debate escalates into an all-out feud, Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson) and Hawkeye (Jeremy Renner) must pick a side.

programme.title: A Fabled Holiday
programme.desc: Talia and her childhood best friend unexpectedly reunite in a curiously familiar-looking town that's full of Christmas spirit.

programme.title: 'Twas the Night Before Christmas

programme.title: Christmas Under Wraps
programme.desc: After unexpectedly moving to Alaska, an ambitious doctor starts a new romance and learns that her small town is hiding a holiday secret.

programme.title: 'Twas the Night Before Christmas
programme.desc: A former actress takes charge of a town's annual Christmas Eve courtroom production, in which the true authorship of the famous poem "A Visit From St. Nick" is debated.

programme.title: Hanukkah on Rye

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: Cricket Celebration Bowl: Jackson State vs. North Carolina Central
programme.desc: The Tigers (12-0) meet the Eagles (9-2) in the Celebration Bowl. Jackson State topped Southern 43-24 to claim the Southwestern Athletic Conference title Dec. 3. Jackson State's Deion Sanders was announced as Colorado's new head coach that night.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: SRS Distribution Las Vegas Bowl: Florida vs. Oregon State
programme.desc: The No. 14 Beavers play the Gators for the Las Vegas Bowl. Florida tries to snap a two-game slide in bowl games. Oregon State has not won a postseason game since 2013. Oregon State's Damien Martinez has topped 100 yards rushing in six straight games.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: LendingTree Bowl: Rice vs. Southern Mississippi
programme.desc: Former conference rivals square off in the LendingTree Bowl as Rice (5-7) plays Southern Miss (6-6). The sides split 12 meetings from 2007-2021 when they were Conference USA rivals. The Owls won the last two get-togethers by a combined 54-25 score.

programme.title: College Football 150: The Greatest
programme.desc: Every season, college football rivals face off -- and the intensity and passion are at a fever pitch. Some clashes have resulted in unforgettable games. These are the Top 11 of those quintessential, classic gridiron battles.

programme.title: Men's College Water Polo
programme.desc: Action from college water polo matches.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.sub-title: North Carolina A&T vs. Norfolk State
programme.desc: The Aggies meet the Spartans for a Chris Paul HBCU Challenge matchup in Las Vegas. This is their first meeting since North Carolina A&T left the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference in 2021. Norfolk State has dropped three of the last four meetings.

programme.title: College Football 150: The Greatest
programme.desc: There's a difference, it turns out, between impossible and improbable. And in college football's long history, there have been a handful of incredible stories of walk-ons who became stars. These are the Top 11 of all time.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Hampton takes on Texas Southern in the Chris Paul HBCU Challenge at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas. The programs have never met. Hampton appeared in the HBCU Challenge last season, falling to Norfolk State and Morgan State in Phoenix.

programme.title: College Football 150: The Greatest
programme.desc: From the top games, rivalries, and traditions to the best innovations, television moments,and Heisman winners, the series features a wide range of countdowns spanning the history of the sport.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: New Mexico Bowl: SMU vs. BYU
programme.desc: The Cougars (7-5) ride a three-game win streak into their New Mexico Bowl meeting with the Mustangs (7-5). BYU plays in its fifth straight bowl, splitting the last four. SMU seeks its first bowl victory since 2012 after losing its last two.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1962, the University of Mississippi erupted in violence over integration while swelling with pride over an unbeaten football team.

programme.title: Auburn @ USC
programme.desc: The Trojans (8-3) take on the No. 19 Tigers (9-1) in the City of Angels. Auburn rebounded from its first loss of the season to beat Georgia State 72-64 on Dec. 14. Boogie Ellis is posting 14.1 points per game for USC, which has won four in a row.

programme.desc: The Broncos (9-4) face the Mean Green (7-6) in the Frisco Bowl. Both schools are coming off a loss in their respective conference title games. North Texas announced former Washington State offensive coordinator Eric Morris as head coach on Dec. 13.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Lady Volunteers visit the No. 2 Cardinal. Stanford has won five in a row since an overtime loss to No. 1 South Carolina on Nov. 20. Stanford has also won three straight over Tennessee after prevailing on this day in 2018, 2019 and 2021.

programme.desc: Top programs collide in the Jumpman Invitational when the Tar Heels face the Wolverines. Both are seeking another feather in their cap in 2022-23. North Carolina won the Phil Knight Invitational, while Michigan prevailed at the Gulf Coast Showcase.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Jumpman Invitational match in Charlotte, N.C., sees the Sooners battle the Gators. Oklahoma's three-game win streak in neutral-site games was snapped Dec. 10 with an 88-78 loss to Arkansas in Tulsa, Okla. Florida is 7-4 after a victory over Ohio.

programme.title: Keyshawn, JWill and Max
programme.desc: ‎Every morning, Keyshawn Johnson joins Jay Williams and Max Kellerman as they set the sports table for the day. From the games that electrified us the night before to the stories that will catch fire during the day, the guys will update and inform.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: Famous Idaho Potato Bowl: Eastern Michigan vs. San Jose State
programme.desc: The Spartans (7-4) play the Eagles (8-4) in the Famous Idaho Potato Bowl. Eastern Michigan looks to ends a four-game postseason slide. EMU's only bowl win remains its first appearance, a 30-27 decision over San Jose State in the 1987 California Bowl.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: RoofClaim.com Boca Raton Bowl: Liberty vs. Toledo
programme.desc: The MAC champion Rockets (8-5) face the Flames (8-4) in the Boca Raton Bowl. Toledo defeated Ohio 17-7 to claim its 12th conference title, and second in the last six years. Liberty rides a three-game slide into its fourth consecutive bowl game.

programme.title: College Football 150: The American Game
programme.desc: As football professionalized, the college game was deeply impacted and forever changed. The two sports are closely connected -- and the conflict between amateur and pro will always undeniably shadow the college game.

programme.title: Boy's High School Basketball
programme.desc: Action from boys high school basketball.

programme.title: College Football 150: The Greatest
programme.desc: From the top games, rivalries, and traditions to the best innovations, television moments,and Heisman winners, the series features a wide range of countdowns spanning the history of the sport.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: LendingTree Bowl: Rice vs. Southern Mississippi
programme.desc: Former conference rivals square off in the LendingTree Bowl as Rice (5-7) plays Southern Miss (6-6). The sides split 12 meetings from 2007-2021 when they were Conference USA rivals. The Owls won the last two get-togethers by a combined 54-25 score.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: Frisco Bowl: North Texas vs. Boise State
programme.desc: The Broncos (9-4) face the Mean Green (7-6) in the Frisco Bowl. Both schools are coming off a loss in their respective conference title games. North Texas announced former Washington State offensive coordinator Eric Morris as head coach on Dec. 13.

programme.desc: The undefeated No. 1 Bulldogs face the Gators in Week 9. Georgia sailed into its bye week with a 55-0 decision against Vanderbilt on Oct. 15. Quarterbacks Stetson Bennett (UGA) and Anthony Richardson (FLA) have each accounted for 12 TDs this year.

programme.title: Georgia @ Kentucky
programme.desc: The SEC East division champion No. 1 Bulldogs take on the rival Wildcats. Georgia secured its spot in the SEC championship game and improved to 10-0 on the year with a 45-19 decision at Mississippi State. Georgia has won 12 straight versus Kentucky.

programme.desc: A look back at the 2019-20 football season for the LSU Tigers, with both a behind-the-scenes and cinematic glimpse at the run by Heisman Trophy winner Joe Burrow, LSU head coach Ed Orgeron and the Bayou Bengals.

programme.desc: While investigating a case of valuable stolen paintings, the roguishly charming and endlessly troublesome Fletch becomes the prime suspect in a murder. To prove his innocence, he must sift through a long list of suspects -- from an art dealer to a missing playboy to a crazy neighbor to his own girlfriend.

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: When aging womanizer Harry Sanborn (Jack Nicholson) and his young girlfriend, Marin (Amanda Peet), arrive at her family's beach house in the Hamptons, they find that her mother, dramatist Erica Barry (Diane Keaton), also plans to stay for the weekend. Erica is scandalized by the relationship and Harry's sexist ways. But when Harry has a heart attack, and a doctor (Keanu Reeves) prescribes bed rest at the Barry home, he finds himself falling for Erica -- who, for once, may be out of his league.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Michel Rivera (24-0, 14 KOs) faces Frank Martin (16-0, 12 KOs) in a lightweight 12-round world title elimination bout.

programme.title: Dead for a Dollar
programme.desc: Veteran bounty hunter Max Borlund heads deep into Mexican territory to find and return Rachel Kidd, the wife of a wealthy businessman. After learning she actually fled from the abusive marriage, Max faces a choice: finish the job he's been hired to do, or stand aside while ruthless mercenary outlaws and his longtime rival close in on a town that's been his temporary sanctuary.

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: Twenty-five years after a streak of brutal murders shocked the quiet town of Woodsboro, Calif., a new killer dons the Ghostface mask and begins targeting a group of teenagers to resurrect secrets from the town's deadly past.

programme.title: A Wonderful Time of the Year
programme.desc: The Marsh family's getting together for their first Christmas Eve after three years of pandemic lockdown.

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: The discovery that she has a terminal illness prompts introverted saleswoman Georgia Byrd (Queen Latifah) to reflect on what she realizes has been an overly cautious life. So Georgia withdraws her life savings and jets off to Europe where she lives like a millionaire. Upbeat and passionate, Georgia charms everybody she meets, including renowned Chef Didier (Gérard Depardieu). The only one missing from her new life is her longtime crush Sean Matthews (LL Cool J).

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Running away together turns out to be difficult with Tammy's past threatening to derail their hopes for marriage; George's past is standing in the way of their future as a recording duo.
